input: Animals and plants die in soft soil or mud Sediment builds up over the remains The remains decompose, leaving only trace amounts The remaining parts over the years are replaced with mineral A fossil is formedsuppose there is a mass extinction happens, how will it affect MORE fossils forming.

Aluminium cans are put into a recycling bin Aluminium cans are then collected and taken to a treatment plant At the treatment plant the aluminium is sorted and cleaned Readied for reprocessing The aluminum cans go through a re-melt process Turned into molten aluminium The molten aluminum is made into large blocks called ingots The ingots are sent to mills and are rolled out into thin sheets The rolls are ready to be made into new aluminum products.suppose more magma explodes to the surface happens, how will it affect MORE aluminum cans being recycled.

Items that can be reused are placed into recycling containers Recycling trucks pick up the items that are able to be reused The recyclable items travel to a recycling plant The items are sorted by what they are made of The items are broken down into small parts The small parts are melted to make new raw parts The raw parts are sold to manufactures to make new items.suppose evaporation will be quicker happens, how will it affect MORE recyling.

The pancreas detects chemical changes in the stomach The pancreas creates juices that help digest food The pancreas releases the juices into the stomach Trypsin and chymotrypsin digest protein Insulin is produced to move glucose from the blood The enzymes begin producing again.suppose Stomach pain increased happens, how will it affect I had a section removed.

Place the water in a pot Cover the pot with a slightly too large cover Place a larger pot under the first Heat water to evaporation Water vapor will collect on the lid Drip into the second pot as fresh water Salt is left behind in the original pot.suppose water will evaporate more quickly happens, how will it affect LESS salt being removed from the water.

An egg is laid by a mother bird A baby bird forms within the egg if it is fertilized The baby bird begins pecking out of the egg The baby bird is unable to fly to get food The mother bird must feed the baby bird food The bird grows stronger and grows wings The bird is able to fly The bird is able to leave the nest and find food The bird is able to reproduce.suppose no predators eat the birds happens, how will it affect more birds will reproduce.

An owl leaves his nest The owl flys out into the night The owl looks down at the ground The owls keen eyesight allows him to see in the dark The owls sensitive hearing allows him to locate hidden prey The owl swoops down The owl catches a mouse in his talons.suppose less heat available happens, how will it affect owls look at the ground less.

Batteries are put in a flashlight The flashlight is turned on Two contact strips touch one another A circuit is completed between the batteries and the lamp The lamp in the flashlight begins to glow The reflector in the flashlight directs the lamp's beam A straight beam of light is generated The flashlight is turned off The circuit is broken The beam is no longer visible.suppose the batteries are old happens, how will it affect HELPING the flashlight to work properly.
